page.title: 08EDUCATION
page.content: The only school in the area is RODE Heath County Primary School belonging to Cheshire Eucation Authority.Up until ten years ago it was a Church school but in 1975 a new school was built to cater for a new housing estate in the village.There are 252 children on roll.The building is open plan so there are no classrooms but there are home bays where children meet as classes before being set work in the large work area.The pupils start in the term they are five and leave in the July in the year when they are eleven.The curriculum is varied involving Maths,Language,Art, P.E.Religion,Science,History and Geography.The last four being done in integrated topic work.French is taught to the top three years.Meals are made in the school kitchens.70 children have dinners 6 go home 176 sandwiches.
